ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: PL800 is a necessary supplement to the American Politics sequence for graduate students, focusing (but not exclusively) on the historical development of institutions. I strongly recommend this course.
Possibly THE indispensable course offered by Yale's department of political science. The opportunity to engage with Professor Mayhew is incomparable.
It's an overview of recent work on major topics in American politics. Definitely take it!
An excellent sampling of recent research in political science.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Beyond the benefits conferred simply through a well-curated reading list, the course also allowed insight into Mayhew's distinct methodological style. My future research will definitely borrow from his techniques: coding of concepts, bringing a comparative perspective, and, of course, reading, reading, reading!
Deepened my knowledge extensively in the subfield of American Politics.
It's a terrific introduction to both a variety of topics and a variety of approaches in American politics, and I feel very well-prepared to continue with American politics.
This course gave me an introduction to research topics and methods in American Politics.
